localString.value: Bulletin Board Notice
Your message is inscribed on this paper. You may post it on any bulletin board.

Thunder Claps Far
Wind Gust Strong
Newbie Merchant
Halfling Attire
Traditional halfling attire, for those who would shun human customs such as boots or other shoes.
Skinning Knife
This is a skinning knife. It is not very useful in combat but when used on a corpse can produce hide and meat. Rangers also use it to hunt.
Holy Symbol
A holy symbol, it may also be used to attack, but very poorly.
Potion of Cure Light Wounds
Used as often in the peasant's home as the dungeon's dark, these simple concoctions are common throughout Faerun.
Acid Flask
A flask of acid that can be thrown at enemies.
Alchemist's Fire
Alchemist's Fire is a sticky, adhesive substance that ignites on contact with air.
Holy Water Flask
Specially blessed water with damaging effects against the Undead.
This is a standard lantern, you must refill it with oil every 6 hours of use.
Oil Flask
This is an oil flask. You may use it to refill a lantern, or try to light it and throw at someone
This is a standard cheap disposable torch.
Food Ration
One standard food ration
Medicine Bag
The kit is full of herbs, salves, bandages, and other useful material. It may be used to stop bleeding, cure poison or disease, and increase the recovery rate of resting patients.
Thieves' Tools
This is the primary tool thieves use to disarm traps and pick locks
Thieves' Tools, Masterwork
This is the primary tool thieves use to disarm traps and pick locks It seems extremely well made
This is a bedroll, to use it, drop it on the ground.
This is a bedroll. You can use it by placing it on the ground.
Tanglefoot Bag

This is a round leather bag full of alchemical goo. When you throw the bag against a creature, the bag comes apart and the goo bursts out, entangling the target and then becoming tough and resilient on exposure to air.
When this stone strikes a hard surface, it creates a deafening bang (a sonic attack).
Water Canteen

This is a water canteen. No adventurer should be without one.
Target a source of water to fill the canteen, or target the ground near you while you are standing next to water.
Food Ration
One standard food ration
Book of Summons

This Tome allows you to chose the creature you want to summon. Simply use the Special Power, then chose the Spell Level and the creature you want to summon with your next spell of that level. This creature will be summoned every time you chose to cast a spell from that level.
Item Strip Trigger
Credits (examine to view)

Nordock is an original creation of Marc "richterm" Richter.
Thanks to all the RR Staff, past and present: Jark, Qui, Misha, Serverhost, Gilron, Silver Surfer, Tier, Chon...and more who I don't recall. Thanks to Bioware for a fantastic game. Thanks to TSR and Gary Gygax for the D&D phenomenom. Dedicated to my wife and kids. --- Thanks go out to all those that have helped customise and expand the Nordock Continuation Project version of Nordock. Credits follow (in alphabetical order): - Allegiance - Auron - Buhfee - Camel - Death - Devalia - EagleC - Evil ZeR0 - Grug - H3g3m0n - Hakai - Jedilamma - Kagerou - Katalyna - Lilamma - Nachos - Nakey - Nid - Paradox - Rapax - Shyan - Skeeter - SoulDance - Stacis - Stargate - Taipan - Tro
Also thanks to The Nordock Continuation Project: http://ganwn.ausgamers.com
Finally this mod is being actively worked on by ntfm to bring the best public Nordock Experience possible. Thank you to all t www.ntfm.org for your help and support.
If you like what we have done here then take ask about our new creation 'Legends Of Ferhan', its completely original, completely new, totally unfinished but it will rock your socks off. Enjoy the game.
The low pedestal gleams an alabaster white, shadows playing across its fluted column.
Bulletin Board
A bulletin board to read and post messages. A scribe is needed to write a message.

HCR Signpost
This granite headstone was carefully chiseled.

Please note: This PLAYZEN server uses a modified variant of the HCR Ruleset, especially in regards to Death. Please review this sign carefully.
Character Generation When a character with 0 experience points enters the game, they are stripped of all items, and given the PHB amount of gold for their class. The player character may now purchase basic items by waiting for the newbie store to appear.
Subraces Subraces are supported. Subraces which require an ECL (effective character level) are not included.
Experience Experience in HCR is now handled per the DMG pg 165. The current Bioware system takes into account Familiars, Summoned Creatures, Animal Companions and Henchmen when calculating your average level. Plus it bases exp on the individual (and pets) level and doesn't do a party split of the EXP. In fact, a single creature actually gives more exp in a larger party with pets than a single pc fighting solo.
This server uses a variant of this system. Base experience is 60 points for a dead critter. Based on the Challenge Rating of the creature and the party level, players will be awarded more or less. After reaching a certain level, a player will recieve less experience per kill.
Death and Dying Death and dying follows what is defined in the Player Handbook (PHB) pg 129 as closely as is possible.
When a player takes damage that reduces them to 0 hp, they are DISABLED. While disabled, a player receives an 80% movement penalty, is Slowed, and is Cursed with -5 pts to all stats save constitution and charisma.
When a player takes damage that reduces them between -1 and -9 hp, they begin to die. They fall to the ground, and a Death Corpse (DC) appears beside them. Everything not equipped on the character, including their gold, appears on the DC. Anyone can loot these items, the intent being that your party members can use the cure potion you have on your body to heal you.
Once a round (6 sec) there is a 10% chance that you will STABILIZE. If you do, you stop bleeding, if not, you take 1pt of damage. Once stabilized, there is a 10% chance per hour (2 min by default timer) that you will enter RECOVERY, if not, you take 1pt of damage. Once in recovery, you have a 10% chance per day of beginning to heal normally. While in recovery, you suffer the exact same penalties as when disabled.
If you heal ANY while -1 to -9, you automatically jump to a stable heal state. You will take no more damage and are under the same effects as when in Recovery.
Once you reach -10 hp, you are dead. All equipped items join your Death Corpse, along with the Player Corpse Token (PCT).
When you die, you get one automatic roll to see if your Deity chooses to notice your passing and resurrect you. There is a 5% chance this will happen, +1% per 4 levels. If not, you are off to the Fugue Plane. Your money is left with your corpse in the real world but all other items travel with you.
Back in the real world, your corpse may be dragged by anyone who picks up your PCT. It weighs 130lbs. When they pick up your PCT, your DC goes to the Storage area, making it look like they picked up your corpse. When they drop the PCT, your DC reappears where they drop it. You can return to the real world by talking to the guardian, or from the real world you can receive 'resurection' or 'true resurection'. The xp penalty for these is 10%, 7%, and 3% respectively and approximately.
Resting and Natural Healing You can rest in game once every 6 hours (12 min). Quitting and returning does not reset this timer. You need food on you to be able to rest. (Cant rest on an empty stomach you just toss and turn all night). When you rest, you only heal 1 hit point per level instead of full heal. This prevents fighters from attack, rest, attack sequence. The 'magical damage' you may see after resting is the module compensating for the default full heal
Food Players may use a skinning knife to carve meat from dead animals and then cook it on a campfire. Alternately they may buy food from merchants.
Skills Healing When using the HC Healing kits, the Healing skill now follows the PHB. Healing only serves to stabilize anyone who is bleeding to death, allows the healer to attempt to cure poison or disease (on a successful heal check), or allows the healer to attempt long term care.
Traps and Locks When using this system, in order to disarm traps or open locks, the player must now use the HC "Thieves' Tools". Traps of DC 21 or more may only be dectected and disarmed by Rogues. You may not use the thieves' tools if you are untrained in disarm trap or unlock. Do so only at your own risk.
Spells and Special Abilities Spell Changes The Summon Creature line (I-IX) now lasts the duration given in the PHB, i.e. 1 round per caster level. (Plus 1 round to make up for NWN Game mechanics). If you want this to last longer, you may set SUMMONTIMER to the number of rounds/level you want it to last. This change does not affect Familiars, which still last till dead or you rest. NOTE: This is set to 6 rounds per level in this module.
You may designate what they Summon Creature line will summon. You may either have one per spell level, or a random set per spell level. This is all defined in the script: hc_summon_inc
The Cure <blank> Wounds series of spells has been modified such that they do not cure for maximum when cast on Players.
Sound Familiar? When a Familiar dies, the familiar's master will now lose 200xp x level of the owner. The owner will be given a chance to avoid half the penalty by making a successful Fortitude check. Feeding a familiar will no longer heal it fully. Sorry, but the ability to spontaneously heal is reserved for Artifact Familiars. If you feel your familiar is getting a bit too daring, simply unsummon it.
Turning Undead Evil Clerics may now dominate the most powerful undead creature that was supposed to be destroyed. The rest of the undead that were meant to die will now follow the cleric. Determining the turning levels for pure Paladins and Paladin/Cleric multiclass is now correct as per PHB p. 56 (fixes a Bioware bug).
Miscellaneous Players may use a flask of oil to create a campfire that they can sit around.

Entrance Exit
Entrance Exit
The sofa seems warm and inviting, perfect for a short nap.
Player Rules, part 1

1. In Game The DM is ALWAYS Right No matter what your interpretation of the rules tells you, the DMs have the final word. Do not "shout" your objections to their decisions ingame. If you do not agree with a ruling, or feel a DM has mistreated you, use the DM channel to discuss this with them directly, email your question or comments in the forums. Do not argue with a DM. It is up to the DMs judgement whether you are breaking a rule.
2. Foul Language Should be limited, especially in the daytime (pre 9pm GMT) For cases where you are unsure if something is considered to be "foul language" refer to rule #1. If you are still not sure, then do not use the word(s) you are considering.
3. Be Considerate of Others
A. The 'Shout' channel has had to be disabled due to misuse by the small majority. You may still send announcements by use of the magical town criers.
B. Do not loot anything that you did not kill... the final blow is not always dealt by the person who actually killed the beast.
C. When in a group, finish the fight before searching the corpses... your party member(s) probably need your help and the loot is not going anywhere.
D. If you run from a monster, try not to lead it onto unsuspecting players. If this does happen, help them defeat the beast (they maybe weaker than you)... be sure to apologize and thank them for the aid.
E. Avoid camping an Area Camping is defined as staying in one area waiting for creatures to respawn and by doing so denying other players of that area's use. This is a RolePlaying server. It is not a powerleveling server. If you only strive for level 40 and "uber gear" perhaps you would be happier elsewhere.
F. If somebody is harassing *you*, or doing "tells" to you that you find insulting take a screen pic (print screen button = pic will be in NWN folder as a TGA file) and give it to a DM. Do not "take matters into your own hands".
4. Roleplay is Encouraged You are encouraged to play the role of your character in your interactions with other characters. People get into their role in different ways and to different ammounts, respect other peoples style of 'role-playing'. If you are in sight of others role-playing please do your best not to spoil the mood for them by talking about the football (or whatver) ;-)
A copy of these rules can be found in your journal and they can be discussed in further detail on the server forums or irc channel.
http://forum.playzen.net irc://quakenet:#playzen
Player Rules, part 2

PvP is only permitted under one of the following circumstances 1. The Arena 2. Both parties have consented. 3. The Encounter is role played and there is an opportunity for the non-initiating character to back down. (run away)
To avoid confusion once you are satified these conditions are met hit PrntScreen. This will save a screen shot in your nwn folder.
A copy of these rules can be found in your journal and they can be discussed in further detail on the server forums or irc channel.
http://forum.playzen.net irc://quakenet:#playzen
